title: Seems to be »handmade«…
content:
Hallo,  
here is a typo i don't know. Could you tell perhaps.  
Thanks and regards,  
Ochi

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121109001254im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo-1_6583.jpg)
author: Ochi

comments.content:
Looks like a version of STOP I believe.

Edit: But STOP never had lowercase that I am aware of. Hmm.

The only digital version I know of is from [Paratype](http://web.archive.org/web/20121109001254/http:/www.paratype.com/pstore/fonts/Motter-Tektura.htm).

- Lex

I wonder if this logotype might have had some input from a sign making business.

I have this (called just Motter) as a font with my [Signlab](http://web.archive.org/web/20121109001254/http:/www.signlab.ca/) vinyl cutting program from Cadlink.

Also ...

Thomas Harvey digitized this as [Mottek](http://web.archive.org/web/20121109001254/http:/www.abstractfonts.com/font/6803) over a decade ago and Aaron Beck tweaked it as [Cupertino](http://web.archive.org/web/20121109001254/http:/www.grsites.com/exec/public/fontview.cgi?dir=c&fn=CU ______ )  
 nearly as long ago. Your best bet is the Paratype version where font quality is at stake, though.

Incidentally, Motter Tektura was the typeface used for [Apple's first logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20121109001254/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_fonts#Motter_Tektura).
